qas.question: What part of Korea did the Soviet Union occupy?
Who occupied Korea south of the 38th parallel?
What United Nation's committee considered the invasion of Korea to be an act of aggression?
How many countries assisted in the defense of South Korea?

context: Korea was ruled by Japan from 1910 until the closing days of World War II. In August 1945, the Soviet Union declared war on Japan and—by agreement with the United States—occupied Korea <a1_0>north of the 38th parallel<a1_0/>. <a2_0>U.S. forces<a2_0/> subsequently occupied the south and <a0_0>Japan<a0_0/> surrendered. By 1948, two separate governments had been set up. Both governments claimed to be the legitimate government of Korea, and neither side accepted the border as permanent. The conflict escalated into open warfare when North Korean forces—supported by the Soviet Union and China—invaded South Korea on 25 June 1950. On that day, the <a3_0>United Nations Security Council<a3_0/> recognized this North Korean act as invasion and called for an immediate ceasefire. On 27 June, the Security Council adopted S/RES/83: Complaint of aggression upon the Republic of Korea and decided the formation and dispatch of the UN Forces in Korea. <a4_0>Twenty-one<a4_0/> countries of the United Nations eventually contributed to the defense of South Korea, with the United States providing 88% of the UN's military personnel.
